alert.note: Alert for DeSoto; Lafayette; Marshall; Panola; Tate (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 5:12AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Lafayette, central DeSoto, Marshall, Tate and northern Panola Counties through 600 AM CDT... At 511 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hernando, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Southaven, Oxford, Hernando, Senatobia, Holly Springs, Batesville, Wall Doxey State Park, John W Kyle State Park, Sardis, Coldwater, Byhalia, Como, Pleasant Grove, Harmontown, Lewisburg, Red Banks, Laws Hill, Barr, Independence and Marianna. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM CDT for northeastern and northwestern Mississippi.
